snippet: Democrats and Republicans have split the last 14 presidential elections, but Republicans have appointed 12 of the last 20 Supreme Court justices
abstract: The Upshot; Supreme Court transitions have again become salient subject, with Pres Obama entering final years of his presidency and Senate control up for grabs; Democrats and Republicans have split the last 14 presidential elections, but Republicans have appointed 12 of the last 20 Supreme Court justices; liberals have surrendered seats on court by being less strategic than conservatives with timing of their retirements.
lead_paragraph: Democrats and Republicans have split the last 14 presidential elections, but Republicans have appointed 12 of the last 20 Supreme Court justices

headline.main: The Supreme Court Blunder That Liberals Tend to Make
headline.print_headline: The Supreme Court Blunder That Liberals Tend to Make
